_description: Two couplets translating ‘Dic homo vas scelerum quid prodest copia rerum / In modica fossa clauderis pellis et ossa’, which precedes it in John Grimestone’s sermon notebook

NLS18721.Transcription:
Sey þu vessel of wrechidnesseWat profitet þe werdis
                    richesseIn a dep pitȝ doun to þe kneSken & bon men solen
                    closen þe
NLS18721.Editions:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             A Descriptive Index of the English Lyrics in John of Grimestone’s
                Preaching Book.
Medium Ævum Monographs
         n.s. 2. Oxford, 1973: 25.
